skill.name: context-management
skill.description: Context management specialist for multi-agent workflows and long-running tasks. Use when coordinating multiple agents, preserving context across sessions, or managing complex project state. Focuses on context compression and distribution.
skill.summary: Context management specialist for multi-agent workflows and long-running tasks. Use when coordinatin...
skill.author: Joseph OBrien

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown files with workflow guidance and MCP tool examples. No executable code, network calls, filesystem access, or command execution capabilities detected.

content.value_statement: Complex projects lose context when switching between agents or sessions. This skill provides structured patterns for capturing, compressing, and distributing context to maintain coherent project state across long-running workflows.
actual_capabilities: Capture key decisions and rationale from conversations
Create context checkpoints for project milestones
Prepare and distribute relevant context to specific agents
Compress context while preserving critical information
Index context for quick retrieval and search
limitations: Cannot access external systems or APIs
Does not persist state automatically between sessions
Does not execute code or run commands
Does not read or write files directly

use_cases.title: Coordinate Agent Handoffs
use_cases.description: Transfer context between AI agents smoothly with structured handoff templates and decision documentation.

use_cases.title: Preserve Project State
use_cases.description: Maintain project context across meetings and sessions with checkpoints and indexed decision records.

use_cases.title: Track Complex Investigations
use_cases.description: Build and navigate knowledge graphs linking concepts, decisions, and project relationships.

prompt_templates.title: Capture Context
prompt_templates.prompt: Capture the key context from this conversation including: current task goals, recent decisions made, active blockers, and next steps needed.

prompt_templates.title: Prepare Agent Context
prompt_templates.prompt: Prepare context for the next agent in this workflow. Include: project overview, relevant decisions, conventions to follow, and pending items.

prompt_templates.title: Create Checkpoint
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a context checkpoint for this project milestone. Document what was accomplished, files changed, decisions made, and items to address next session.

prompt_templates.title: Compress Context
prompt_templates.prompt: Compress this context while preserving key information. Remove redundant details, summarize completed work, and reference files instead of including full content.

output_examples.input: Capture the key context from this conversation
output: Current Task: Implementing user authentication module
Recent Decisions: Chose JWT tokens with refresh rotation over session cookies
Active Blockers: Waiting on API endpoint specs from backend team
Next Steps: Complete OAuth integration, write unit tests, update API documentation

best_practices: Capture rationale, not just outcomes, to help future reasoning
Create checkpoints at natural milestones to enable safe resumption
Distribute only relevant context to each agent to reduce noise
anti_patterns: Including all conversation history instead of relevant context
Failing to document decisions and their reasoning
Storing sensitive information like credentials in context

faq.question: Which AI tools are supported?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Context patterns apply across all three platforms.

faq.question: What are the token limits for context?
faq.answer: Quick context stays under 500 tokens. Full context targets 2000 tokens. Archive older details separately.

faq.question: How does this integrate with memory tools?
faq.answer: Complements MCP memory tools by providing structured patterns for entity creation, observation tracking, and relationship mapping.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: This skill is purely prompt-based. No data leaves your sessions. You control what context is captured and shared.

faq.question: Why is context getting lost between sessions?
faq.answer: AI sessions are stateless. Use context checkpoints at the end of each session and provide summary at the start of new sessions.

faq.question: How is this different from memory MCP?
faq.answer: Memory MCP stores persistent information. This skill provides patterns for structuring and distributing context within and between sessions.
